intro: Tridelta aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange tridelta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its three-lobed leaves and showy orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tridelta aurantiaca is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
